extendedIngredients.name: garlic
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 cloves garlic, peeled, minced, grated or crushed

extendedIngredients.name: russet potatoes
extendedIngredients.originalString: 8 russet potatoes (3 1/2 lbs.), peeled and cubed

extendedIngredients.name: sea-salt
extendedIngredients.originalString: sea salt and pepper, to taste

recipes.title: Gluten Free Roasted Red Pepper Mashed Potatoes
recipes.instructions: Add potatoes to a pot of filtered water; bring to a boil and lower to medium heat; and cook until tender upon inserting a steak knife.Make grilled red peppers (recipe below).In a small preheated, pre-oiled sauce pan, sauté garlic for about 1-2 minutesOnce potatoes are done cooking, drain water from pan.Add peppers to your food processor or blender and puree.Add peppers, potatoes, butter, salt and pepper to the large bowl of your mixer or preferably a food processor; pulsate or beat until all lumps are smooth.Slice peppers in half, remove seeds and any white portions you can remove with your fingers, including the stem area.Place red peppers over the flame of your gas stove; outdoor or indoor grill; or under the broiler in your oven. Allow the skin only to char (blacken).  Try to get all of the skin blackened, as what is not charred will be harder to remove later.Place in a sealed container (zip lock bag; left over container, etc.) until ready to use, at least 15 minutes.Remove from container, rinse under cold water while removing rubbing the skin off with your fingers.Cut into pieces to speed up pureeing in the food processor.If you wish to prepare the peppers a day or two ahead of time brush or spray the peppers with olive oil and store in a sealed container.

steps.step: Add potatoes to a pot of filtered water; bring to a boil and lower to medium heat; and cook until tender upon inserting a steak knife.Make grilled red peppers (recipe below).In a small preheated, pre-oiled sauce pan, sauté garlic for about 1-2 minutes
Once potatoes are done cooking, drain water from pan.
Add peppers to your food processor or blender and puree.

Add peppers, potatoes, butter, salt and pepper to the large bowl of your mixer or preferably a food processor; pulsate or beat until all lumps are smooth.Slice peppers in half, remove seeds and any white portions you can remove with your fingers, including the stem area.

Place red peppers over the flame of your gas stove; outdoor or indoor grill; or under the broiler in your oven. Allow the skin only to char (blacken).  Try to get all of the skin blackened, as what is not charred will be harder to remove later.
Place in a sealed container (zip lock bag; left over container, etc.) until ready to use, at least 15 minutes.
Remove from container, rinse under cold water while removing rubbing the skin off with your fingers.
Cut into pieces to speed up pureeing in the food processor.If you wish to prepare the peppers a day or two ahead of time brush or spray the peppers with olive oil and store in a sealed container.
